heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: The last storm was on 04 September 2025 which lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and outside temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 12 mbar) and light levels (up 3287 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 4.7°C), dew point temperature (up 3.0°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and outside temperature (up 4.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 144.2m higher than yesterday, 448.9m higher than the past week, 558.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 767m and a peak of 3570m, averaging 1996.7m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and bright intervals likely. Similar weather conditions should remain.
